labels.analysis: The MCP Server provides access to real-time and historical financial data sourced from Yahoo Finance. Its core functionality revolves around retrieving stock prices, financial statements (income, cash flow), dividends, earnings dates, and analyst recommendations, as well as fetching news related to stocks. It enables LLM applications to answer finance-related queries with up-to-date market data, making it a valuable tool for financial analysis, research, and decision-making.
labels.reasoning: The server's tools are primarily focused on financial data retrieval, making "Financial Services" the most appropriate primary label. Secondary labels like "Data Analysis & Processing" (for financial statements, historical data analysis) and "Web Search & Research" (for analyst recommendations and stock news) also apply. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover its functionality.

tools.name: cmd_run
tools.description: Execute an arbitrary shell command and return its output.

tools.name: get_recommendations
tools.description: Get analyst recommendations for a given symbol.

symbol.description: Stock symbol in Yahoo Finance format.

tools.name: get_news
tools.description: Get news for a given stock symbol.

symbol.description: Stock symbol in Yahoo Finance format.

tools.name: get_current_stock_price
tools.description: Get the current stock price based on stock symbol.

symbol.description: Stock symbol in Yahoo Finance format.

tools.name: get_stock_price_by_date
tools.description: Get the stock price for a given stock symbol on a specific date.

symbol.description: Stock symbol in Yahoo Finance format.

tools.name: get_stock_price_date_range
tools.description: Get the stock prices for a given date range for a given stock symbol.

symbol.description: Stock symbol in Yahoo Finance format.

start_date.description: The start date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

end_date.description: The end date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

tools.name: get_historical_stock_prices
tools.description: Get historical stock prices for a given stock symbol.

symbol.description: Stock symbol in Yahoo Finance format.

period.description: The period for historical data. Defaults to "1mo". Valid periods: "1d", "5d", "1mo", "3mo", "6mo", "1y", "2y", "5y", "10y", "ytd", "max"

interval.description: The interval beween data points. Defaults to "1d". Valid intervals: "1d", "5d", "1wk", "1mo", "3mo"

tools.name: get_dividends
tools.description: Get dividends for a given stock symbol.

symbol.description: Stock symbol in Yahoo Finance format.

tools.name: get_income_statement
tools.description: Get income statement for a given stock symbol.

symbol.description: Stock symbol in Yahoo Finance format.

freq.description: At what frequency to get cashflow statements. Defaults to "yearly". Valid freqencies: "yearly", "quarterly", "trainling"

tools.name: get_cashflow
tools.description: Get cashflow for a given stock symbol.

symbol.description: Stock symbol in Yahoo Finance format.

freq.description: At what frequency to get cashflow statements. Defaults to "yearly". Valid freqencies: "yearly", "quarterly", "trainling"

tools.name: get_earning_dates
tools.description: Get earning dates.

symbol.description: Stock symbol in Yahoo Finance format.

limit.description: max amount of upcoming and recent earnings dates to return. Default value 12 should return next 4 quarters and last 8 quarters. Increase if more history is needed.

server_info_crawled.name: Yahoo Finance Data Server
server_info_crawled.author: @marckwei/no-use-tools
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide real-time and historical financial data from Yahoo Finance to enhance your LLM applications. Access stock prices, company information, and perform financial comparisons seamlessly. Enable your agents to answer finance-related queries with up-to-date market data.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@marckwei/no-use-tools/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
